title: SB 1186
content:
The people of the State of California enact the following. The sum of $647,443.32 is appropriated to the Executive Officer of the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board for payment of accepted claims from specified funds. Claims will be paid according to a set schedule. Total for Fund: Item 2660-001-0042, Program 1835010 - $47.31
Total for Fund: Item 2740-001-0044, Program 2130 - $966.22
Total for Fund: Item 4260-101-0001, Program 3960022 - $2,028.06
Total for Fund: Item 5180-111-0001, Program 4275010 - $15,567.57
Total for Fund: Item 7100-001-0185, Program 5930 - $22,537.91 The Controller shall transfer surcharges and fees from specified Budget Act items to a designated fund as requested by the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board. The transferred amount for each item shall not exceed the total per claim filing fee and surcharge authorized by the Government Code. For items without a Budget Act appropriation, the Controller will transfer a specified amount. The Controller transfers surcharges and fees to a designated fund for the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board. The transferred amount is limited to the total per claim filing fee and surcharge authorized by the Government Code. For items without a Budget Act appropriation, a specified amount is transferred to support board reimbursements. A report on the recovered amounts must be provided to the Department of Finance within 90 days. The General Fund appropriates $581,600 to the Executive Officer of the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board for Obie Steven Anthony III's claim, and $653,600 for John Smith's claim. The General Fund appropriates $564,100 to the Executive Officer of the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board for Michael Smith's claim, and $512,600 for Timothy Gantt's claim. The General Fund appropriates $654,500 for Marco Milla's claim and $762,440 for Larry Pohlschneider's claim through the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board. The General Fund appropriates $936,880 to the Executive Officer of the California Victim Compensation and Government Claims Board for Luther Ed Jones, Jr.'s claim. This act is an urgency statute for the immediate preservation of public peace, health, or safety. To quickly address state claims and alleviate claimants' hardships, this act must take effect immediately.
